(This was as far away as I could get)

Still replacing it though because it's just so ugly.

1098 parts isn't actually that bad, you could probably use it in battle, not only that but bringing a 500 part ship like victory near it would probably melt most PCs.

- - - Updated - - -

Did you make it longer?

I can't see any difference....

Four more fuel tanks and engines, 700m/s (ish)of extra delta-V.

MOAR DELTA-V!!!

http://i.imgur.com/HY28ExD.png

Hehehe

Drekevaks in a nutshell

1098 parts isn't actually that bad, you could probably use it in battle, not only that but bringing a 500 part ship like victory near it would probably melt most PCs..

Part Count isn't the issue, aesthetics and inefficient use of hangar space is. The avalon can carry 20 light fighters while what I called the Xibit class can muster 12 because the hangar is too large.

Ok I've just taken my turn. I moved the Vanguard and attacked your lightest ship to keep it fair.

I fired the 6 I beam rockets and though I did damage, your ship is still operational as far as I can see. To end my turn I turned round and went into a retrograde orbit.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/yjnhg3eb60jctr0/persistent.sfs?dl=0

Drekevaks in a nutshell

I take inspiration from your ships a lot:

Hmm I swear 2 rockets were still attached at the front? Maybe they simply hadn't drifted off the ship yet.

I just put 'Drek' into google translate...

I didn't expect that.

I just put 'Drek' into google translate...

I didn't expect that.

i know I've been told before I assure you it's not intentional... "Drek" is short for Drekevak (variation on spelling of Drecavac) and by the time I realized it it was far too late.

on the other hand it makes the phrase "You better check yourself before you Drek yourself" infinitely better

Edited October 28, 2014 by zekes
Nevermind, to be fair it doesn't look intentional at all.

I've been reading the thread, and I fancy making a couple of ships. If someone could answer a few queries for me that would be great.

What kind of tonnage/part count brackets should I build ships for?

How much delta-v, roughly speaking, does a combat ship need?

Thanks in advance.
For delta-V I always go for at least 3,000m/s, the tonnage can range from about 10-20 tons all the way up to 220 tons, after that (for me at least) the ship is just too impractical to use.

What kind of tonnage/part count brackets should I build ships for?

Any size you want. Just try to keep fighters below 200 parts and larger ships below 600. (fully armed)

How much delta-v, roughly speaking, does a combat ship need?

About 500m/s for a fighter. Probably around 3000m/s for a capital ship. These are just guesstimates though.
Ok, thanks for the info. I'll have to give it a shot, see what I come up with.

I look forward to seeing your style of ship building.

Also, I just spent a few minutes making this:

246 parts and 23.23 tons.

Edited October 28, 2014 by Megalodon 720

Frozen_Heart: So, um, before I go and put up my next turn... Did you mean that you would engage my lightest ship and then we would be free to attack other targets?

Or is this battle going to continue with the lightest-remaining-ship engages lightest-remaining-ship trend?

Because I'll gladly redo my turn again. (I... um... exploded your capital ship )

EDIT: To save time...

Operation Aurerran Storm: Battle Update

LYC-A1 Kiternyae to engage CJS Revenge

This time, only 1 salvo of the 2 rockets. Ju need tu wurk on ze armoring!

Every time I've seen that ship destroyed its been a shot in the centre. :/ That's a pretty major design flaw.

Next version I'm going to redo the armour from scratch and also rotate the engine block by 90 degrees which I think will improve the look.
Have you tried adding an armour belt around the weeak zone? Making a double-layer of armour only where it is needed.
